prompt:
What is the school doing to celebrate Chinese New Year

###
completion:
The school will be celebrating Chinese New Year with a concert in the hall, and timetable will be suspended from 11.30 a.m. to 1.00 p.m. for the celebration
END

prompt:
What is the dress code for the Chinese New Year celebration

###
completion:
Students and staff are encouraged to come to school dressed in red or Chinese traditional ethnic attire
END

prompt:
What is the dress code for the Chinese New Year celebration for students who choose not to wear red or Chinese traditional ethnic attire

###
completion:
Students who choose not to wear red or Chinese traditional ethnic attire must come in their school uniform
END

prompt:
What is the programme for the Chinese New Year celebration

###
completion:
The programme will consist of several items to promote a deeper understanding on the significance of Chinese New Year and how Chinese New Year is celebrated
END

prompt:
Are there any guidelines that students should follow during the celebration

###
completion:
Yes, all students should adhere to the school guidelines such as putting on the standard school shoes, not wearing jeans and T shirt, and not putting on any jewellery
END

prompt:
What should parents or students do if they have any queries about the celebration

###
completion:
If students have any queries, they can email Ng Ngin Huay at ng_ngin_huay@moe.edu.sg
END
